snippet: Douglas Hampton pleaded guilty this week to illegally lobbying his former Senate boss, John Ensign, who resigned last year under threat of expulsion but has not been charged in the case.
abstract: Douglas Hampton pleads guilty in federal court to illegally lobbying his one-time boss, former Sen John Ensign; Hampton faces up to one year in prison and a $100,000 fine; some observers have questioned the Justice Department's decision to pursue Hampton so vigorously while failing to bring charges against Ensign for his own role in the lobbying scheme.
lead_paragraph: Douglas Hampton pleaded guilty this week to illegally lobbying his former Senate boss, John Ensign, who resigned last year under threat of expulsion but has not been charged in the case.

headline.seo: Ex-Ensign Aide Pleads Guilty in Scheme That Snared Only Him
headline.main: Ex-Aide to Senator Pleads Guilty in Scheme That Snared Only Him
headline.print_headline: Ex-Aide to Senator Pleads Guilty in Scheme That Snared Only Him
